Amazingly, the code almost works save that I’m only getting values from the last sensor instantiated; m_leftSensor shows the same value as m_rightSensor. Has anyone gotten this approach to work with Distance Sensors? My \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/SOTACyberdragons/frc-robot-2022/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/utils/MultiplexedDistanceSensor.java\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003emultiplexed distance wrapper \u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/SOTACyberdragons/frc-robot-2022/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/Robot.java\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eRobot.java\u003c/a\u003e, where I instantiate the objects can be found here. When we had it create a new instance of the object every time we wanted to read from the sensor, we ran into the same issue you seem to be having. You can see our code for reference \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/4201VitruvianBots/RapidReact2022/blob/master/src/main/java/frc/vitruvianlib/utils/TCA9548AcolorSensor.java\" rel=\"noopener
